definitions.definition: The legal right to take care of something or somebody, especially children.
examples: The court awarded custody to the child's father.
The mother gained custody of the children.

definitions.definition: Temporary possession or care of somebody else's property.
examples: I couldn't pay the bill and now my passport is in custody of the hotel management.

definitions.definition: The state of being imprisoned or detained , usually pending a trial .
examples: He was mistreated while in police custody .

definitions.definition: An area under the jurisdiction of a custos within the Order of Friars Minor.
examples: The Custody of the Holy Land includes the monasteries of Bethlehem, Nazareth, and Jerusalem.

main_definition: The legal right to take care of something or somebody, especially children.
secondary_definitions: Temporary possession or care of somebody else's property.
The state of being imprisoned or detained , usually pending a trial .
( Roman Catholicism ) An area under the jurisdiction of a custos within the Order of Friars Minor.
